question: In the 1930s, who was the first to win all 4 tennis Grand Slam titles?
api_result: In the 1930s, the first person to win all four tennis Grand Slam titles was Don Budge. He achieved this remarkable feat in 1938, becoming the first player ever to win all four major singles titles (Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, and US Open) in the same calendar year. This accomplishment is known as the Grand Slam.
